heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 0 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: It is currently one of the longest windy periods.  It is the ranked 5th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 4 consecutive days where it has been windy starting on 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 279 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 530m and a peak of 1993m, averaging 731.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and very little to no wind will be present. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and light levels will be low during the day. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
